proper noun.description: A country in the Caucasus of southwestern Asia, on the eastern shore of the Black Sea; population 3,800,000 (estimated 2015); languages, Georgian (official), Russian, and Armenian; capital, Tbilisi.

A state in the southeastern US, on the coast of the Atlantic Ocean; population 9,685,744 (est. 2008); capital, Atlanta. Founded as an English colony in 1732 and named after George II, it became one of the original thirteen states of the Union in 1788.
